title: Barry Gibb
summary: Sir Barry Alan Crompton Gibb CBE (born 1 September 1946) is a British-American   musician, singer-songwriter and record producer who rose to worldwide fame as a co-founder of the group the Bee Gees, one of the most commercially successful groups in the history of popular music. With his younger brothers, fraternal twin brothers Robin and Maurice Gibb, he formed a songwriting partnership beginning in 1955. He has lived in Britain, Australia, and the United States, holding dual UKâ€“US citizenship, the latter since 2009.
